data.title: abbeys castles and ancient halls of by john timbs alexander
authors: John Timbs, Alexander Gunn  [Henry Charles Dickens]
data.meta_description: Abbeys, Castles and Ancient Halls of England and Wales : North and Wales by John Timbs & Alexander Gunn. Fredk. Warne, 1111.  Hardcover. Good.  571 pages. No dust jacket. Red cloth with gilt lettering. Pages are lightly tanned and thumbed at the edges, with light foxing. Binding has remained firm. Boards are a little rub worn, slight shelf wear to corners, spine and edges. Corners are a little bumped. Spine ends are mildly crushed. Tanning to spine and edges. Boards are bowed. Book has a forward lean. Water marks to boards and spine....

Abbeys, Castles and Ancient Halls of England and Wales: Their Legendary Lore and Popular History (North)

by John Timbs, Alexander Gunn [Henry Charles Dickens]

Used

Near Fine

Show Details

Description:

London: Frederick Warne and Co, 1895. Excellent. Near Fine. pp 573 A splendid leather bound volume presented by St Stanislau's College, Beaumont to Henry Charles Dickens for merit in Geography, 1895. In a particularly fine binding of red leather with gilt titles and decoration, the arms of the school embossed to front cover. With marbled end papers and edges, high quality paper and tissue guards to all illustrations. Near fine, the book appears to be unread with some rubbing to the spine being the only blemish. Henry Charles Dickens was the novelist Charles Dickens's eighth child and a successful barrister. Near Fine Please contact Christian White Rare Books Ltd for more information or images of this item 1895

Show Details

Abbeys, Castles, and Ancient Halls of England and Wales; Their Legendary Lore and Popular History

by John Timbs; Alexander Gunn (ed.)

Used

Very Good

Hardcover

Show Details

Description:

London: Frederick Warne And Co, 1872. Cloth. Very Good. 7.5" by 5". None. The second edition of John Timb's extensive work on the legends and histories associated with English and Welsh castles, abbeys, and halls. The second edition of John Timbs' work on the abbeys, castles, and ancient halls of England and Wales, edited and enlarged by Alexander Gunn. County by county, Timbs enumerates the histories and folklore associated with the abbeys and castles found across England and Wales. Whilst volume I focuses on the South, volumes two and three concentrate on the midlands and the north respectively. Prior owner's ink inscription to the title page of all three volumes, 'Downes. 30.9.00' With a page of publisher's adverts to the rear of volume I. With four and six pages of publisher's adverts to the rear of volumes II and III respectively. In the publisher's original green cloth binding. Externally, generally smart. Lightly rubbed to the boards, more so to the joints. Bumped to the head and… Read More
